result.execSummary:
The defendant Racheal Am Carrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall pay fine & costs within 60 days or set payment plan with Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with Walmart, Beaver Dam WI.   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

11:12. Defendant, Racheal Am Carrick, in court.  Legal Intern, Kevin Schmidt, appeared for the State of Wisconsin, under the supervision of Atty James Sempf.  Court questions Defendant.  Court finds Deft f/k/v/i waived right to counsel.  Court reviews chrgs + pnlts.  Deft enters NC plea to Ct. 1.  Court finds plea made f/v/k/i, accepts plea and finds Deft guilty of Ct. 1.  Court dismisses  D-RI ct.s 2 + 3.  Court orders $100 + cc. ($50/day for faillure to pay)

9:20 - Defendant, Racheal Am Carrick in court, Intern Kevin Schmidt for Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. P&S set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with Walmart, Beaver Dam WI.  Return date scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 11:15 am.
